alert.note: Alert for Central Piscataquis; Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Northern Piscataquis; Northern Somerset; Northwest Aroostook; Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 25 at 2:44PM EST until January 26 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 PM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy Snow with mixed precipitation expected across Eastern and Southern areas of the warning. Total snow accumulations between 9 and 14 inches, sleet accumulations up to one tenth of an inch and ice accumulations one tenth to around one quarter of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of Central Highlands, Far Eastern, Far Northern, and North Woods Maine * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 7 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Visibilities may drop below one quarter mile due to falling and blowing snow Thursday morning into midday. Whiteout conditions are expected and will make travel treacherous and potentially life-threatening. Sporadic power outages and minor tree damage are possible due to the ice and gusty winds. The hazardous conditions will impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of snow, sleet, and ice will make travel extremely dangerous. The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to newengland511.org.
